alert.note: Alert for Jones; Shackelford; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 9:25AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Jones, Shackelford and southeastern Throckmorton Counties through 1030 AM CST... At 924 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a few strong thunderstorms from southern Jones County, through central Shackelford, and southeastern Throckmorton counties, all moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anson, Albany, Hawley, Lueders, Woodson, Noodle, Ibex, Nugent, Avoca, Fort Griffin, Funston, Mccarty Lake, Lusk, Lake Fort Phantom Hill, The Intersection Of Us-283 And Ranch Road 209, Us- 180 Near The Shackelford- Stephens County Line, The Intersection Of Us- 180 And Farm Road 600, Hodges, The Intersection Of Us-183 And Us- 283 and Big Country Baptist Assembly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
